events.name: Quantopian QuantCon Singapore 2017
events.description: NOTE: This event is organized by Quantopian.  Please purchase tickets on their site. Quantopian is bringing their algorithmic trading and quantitative finance conference, QuantCon (http://bit.ly/QuantConSingapore), back to Singapore on September 28th-30th. Early bird tickets are now available for a limited time. Register Today: http://bit.ly/QuantConSingapore The 3-day program will feature:  • Hands-on algorithmic trading workshops to help you craft, improve, and trade your investment strategy. • Expert talks and tutorials from leaders in the fields of quantitative finance, algorithmic trading, and machine learning. • An algorithmic trading hackathon where you can put your investment strategy skills to the test.  If you are interested in attending either a workshop, the main conference, the hackathon, or all three, click here: http://bit.ly/QuantConSingapore.  Register soon, before the early bird tickets run out.  If you have any questions, feel free to contact events@quantopian.com.
events.location: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel, 392 Havelock Road, Singapore 169663

events.name: QuantCon 2017 - Friends of PyDataSG
events.description: We are proud to be a partner at QuantCon 2017, September 28th - 30th.   This is a quantitative finance and algorithmic trading conference where interactive workshops were offered to help craft, improve, and trade your trading strategies, networking opportunities with leaders from the quantitative finance field, an algorithmic trading hackathon where you can test your skills, and talks on investment strategies, quantitative finance, alternative data sets, machine learning, and more. As members of Singapore PyData community, you enjoy 10% discount of the any tickets by using the discount code QuantCon10! Academic discount rates, as well as group rates are also available upon request.  Register here: https://quantconsingapore2017.splashthat.com/ Act fast! Sign up while the tickets are still available!
events.location: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel , 392 Havelock Road  Singapore

events.name: Master of Science in Technopreneurship & Innovation (Information Session)
events.description:
MSc TIP Information Session on 28th September 2017 (Thurs)
Date:     28th September 2017, Thursday
Venue:  Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel, Level 2, Belimbing room
Time:     6:30pm to 9:00pm
 
 
Agenda
 6:30pm: Registration
 7:00pm: Talk -  "Open Innovation - Just a Buzzword?" by Associate Professor David Butler, Nanyang Technological University
 7:45pm: Introduction to MSc TIP and sharing by Alumni
 
 
Synopsis

Open Innovation – Just a Buzzword?
Open innovation has become a hot topic in the past decade as more and more companies become aware of the advantages of such an approach to help accelerate the development of new ideas, products and services. This talk will introduce both the concept of open and closed innovation and illustrate, through case studies from companies such as Lego and Starbucks, how open innovation has helped a number of the world’s leading companies to stay ahead of their competitors. Open innovation is not only restricted to activities between companies and the speaker will show how we can or may have already unwittingly get involved in the process.
 
 
* NTC reserves the rights to make changes according to circumstances
events.group_name: Nanyang Technopreneurship Center (NTC), Nanyang Technological University

events.name: GTT0928: User Trust - Fighting the Shadows: An Insider’s tale
events.description:
Fighting the Shadows: An Insider’s tale User Trust, Safety and Identity protection are classic adversarial learning challenges: As soon as an automated system successfully learns how to stop one scheme, fraudsters mutate and change their attack patterns. Against intelligent adversaries in a fluid problem space, the Trust and Safety team at Grab operates with the mandate of keeping the ecosystem safe and fair for all our users, passengers and drivers alike. The rapidly evolving fraud trends of the world constantly requires new approaches to age-old problems. Thus, this session will describe our machine learning techniques in providing a safety score and detecting incentive fraud to help Grab stay informed and secure in the complex two-sided marketplace that powers the ride hailing ecosystem. The speakers will share their experiences, data driven case-studies and the unique lessons they learned from combining theoretical expertise, technology and human intuition to the spectrum of good, bad and grey that is the world of user trust, identity and safety. Overall, this talk will benefit anyone interested in adversarial learning, human psychology and game theory. " 


Please RSVP here. We look forward to seeing you at the event! 


Agenda: • 19:00 - Registration Opens • 19:10 - Happy Hour Networking with Bites & Drinks • 19:20 - Welcome Remarks & Presenter Introduction • 19:30 - Speaker #1: Jia Long, Data Scientist at Grab • 20:00 - Speaker #2: Jeffrey Siaw, Data Scientist at Grab • 20:30 - Audience Q&A Session • 21:00 - Closing Remarks • 21:10 - Further Networking with Bites & Drinks • 22:00 – Closing 


Speakers Profile: https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/aPAqoFY2HDIStsHwWrVnW_E6xrXQCtC3zWg2Ys4zCbAizLZPolzLl2aKOwqdtIKG949MDyPHtu28mCrzryrhfz8DdEFKdAlBZeA1yIh49zV_lJoFPdB-XNJpi-d5A13Bkt4MXSsv Jia Long currently holds the position of Data Scientist (User Trust) for Grab. He works closely with analysts across the region to ensure that the Grab ecosystem is a safe and fair place for all it's customers. Coming from the seismic industry with a signal processing background with an interest in data visualisation and web design, he brings a different perspective to the transport industry. Jia Long received his Masters in Petroleum Geophysics from Imperial College in London, UK. https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/3bryCk-TUyVS3W6rT04_Bc44EcNtBhuuoKjtcbSMLKqkYCfSFVkPefYZuvlLtpCt0r2z-CMdcOPPWqC81HJHT6uhZZLXcPo0IjUnOvrNXcwM2s-2KvBtFOhbCCxoqLABPKPwI7gb Jeffrey is a Data Scientist on the User Trust team. He has a background in Machine Learning and at Grab, he works on problems ranging from driver safety, text classification to fraud. On weekends, he enjoys cooking and binge watching entire seasons of TV shows in one sitting. Jeffrey received his Masters in Computational Statistics and Machine Learning from University College London in London, UK. 


Note: Please RSVP here first and we can only allow those that are listed here as RSVP’d to join our event as we have limited capacity. About Grab Tech Thursdays: Grab Tech Thursdays is a monthly series for peers in Asia's tech startup community to share knowledge and best practices as well as provide an informal space for networking. Originally conceived within Grab to focus on pushing the boundaries of technology and business to Drive Southeast Asia Forward, we are excited to now make available these sessions on the last Thursday of each month to the wider tech/startup community. Stay tuned and check back for our line-up of interesting speakers and content.
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square #10-01, 049481 Singapore

events.name: Book Club: Stanford Machine Learning via Coursera
events.description: We're doing this Machine Learning course from Stanford on Coursera together as a group: https://www.coursera.org/learn/machine-learning Excerpt from course description: This course provides a broad introduction to machine learning, datamining, and statistical pattern recognition. Topics include: • Supervised learning (parametric/non-parametric algorithms, support vector machines, kernels, neural networks). • Unsupervised learning (clustering, dimensionality reduction, recommender systems, deep learning). • Best practices in machine learning (bias/variance theory; innovation process in machine learning and AI).  The course will also draw from numerous case studies and applications, so that you'll also learn how to apply learning algorithms to building smart robots (perception, control), text understanding (web search, anti-spam), computer vision, medical informatics, audio, database mining, and other areas. This course runs for 11 Weeks – ends in December and requires between 5 and 10 hours of time per week. The course can be taken for free, or for a small fee to Coursera you can have your assignments graded and receive a certificate at the end. Singaporeans are able to claim the course fees with http://www.skillsfuture.sg/. We will be meeting weekly on Thursdays to discuss both lectures and assignments. At each meetup we'll discuss the previous week's lectures and the current assignment. You should have watched the lectures and at least made a start on the assignment, if not completed it. Doors open 7pm. Meetup starts 7:30pm and usually runs to 9:00/9:30pm. Bring dinner/snacks and/or eat beforehand. Press 06160🔔 at the intercom downstairs so we can buzz you in. Note the change of address if you attended previous book club events.
events.location: Tim and Wei's Residence, #06-160, 9 Boon Keng Road, Singapore

events.name: Python for Beginners!
events.description: We will be conducting a free meetup to teach new programmers how to code using Python. At the end of two hours, you will learn to write simple code in Python and execute the program. This lesson is targeted at new beginners who have no prior background in coding. If you have experienced programming before, this course's pace might be too slow for you. As spaces are limited, priority goes to new programmers. This is a very basic course, we highly recommend it to anyone who's interested to pick up coding even if you have no prior background at all. For this lesson, you must bring along your own computer (any system) and be prepared to learn how to write code! There are no other prerequisites.
events.location: Tri5 Ventures, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-26, S139951, Singapore

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Aditi Kulkarni, Head of Design, Referral Candy
events.description: Hey everyone! We're back once again in September for this Design Leader series where we have a conversation with Design leaders, Principle consultants, influential designers improving lives through UX.  This month we'll be speaking with Aditi Kulkarni, Head of Design & UX at Singapore based startup, ReferralCandy.  About Aditi Aditi Kulkarni, Head of Design & UX at Singapore based startup, ReferralCandy. the best automated referral program for online retailers. (ReferralCandy has raised S$2M in funding and recently tripled its revenue.) In her previous role as VP Design at Postman she lead product design and helped grow the user base to more than 4M developers, eventually leading to Series A funding of $7M.  Aditi is a big fan of effective, collaborative and goal oriented design. She loves trying various experiments to see what works best in a lean product team. In her free time you can find her tinkering and making interactive installations inspired by city life.  --- Agenda for the evening 7pm – 7.30pm: Registration, networking.  7.30pm – 8.30pm: Conversation with Aditi 8.30pm – 9pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. The value of the meetup is as good as the questions asked :) Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at kiat@ixda.sg and I'll ask them on your behalf :) Alternatively, you may like to tweet us the questions to @IxDASG and we can have that answered! P/s: The ReferralCandy team recently launched a brand new loyalty product called CandyBar. It's a digital loyalty app for the millions of SMB's out there. With CandyBar, SMB retailers can run and track their business from their pocket. They're Hiring! --- Venue sponsor:   A big thanks to the folks at District6 for sponsoring the venue and hosting us! District6 is a brand new co-working space located just at City Hall (2 mins walk from Raffles City!)
events.location: District 6 , Odeon Towers #02-01/08 331 North Bridge Road , Singapore
